data.title: Sri Lankan leaders to talk about unity
data.meta_description: The Globe and Mail offers the most authoritative news in Canada, featuring national and international news
data.text:
Sri Lanka suspended direct talks with Tamil Tiger rebels yesterday while the country's feuding leaders tried to resolve a personal power struggle stemming from the effort to end 19 years of civil war.

President Chandrika Kumaratunga extended an olive branch to Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe yesterday, inviting him for talks on forming a unity government later this week. There was no immediate response from Mr. Wickremesinghe's office, nor from the Tigers. AP
